archimate:Assessment.name: Number of new architectures are known to bypass security review
archimate:Assessment.documentation: The "Number of new architectures known to bypass security review" metric indicates the count of newly created system designs that, for some reason, have not undergone the usual security review process. A security review is a crucial step in verifying that a system's design aligns with the organization's security standards and best practices. Bypassing this review could potentially leave undiscovered vulnerabilities in the system. This metric, therefore, serves as a crucial red flag, drawing attention to any new designs that may need to be reviewed to ensure the overall security of our digital systems and infrastructure.
